column4: hello all, how do i loginto a remote desktop set up on an ubuntu machine, from my windows work box? i already have ssh set and working, but ide like my GUI >.>
hello all, how do i loginto a remote desktop set up on an ubuntu machine, from my windows work box? i already have ssh set and working, but ide like my GUI >.>
a default install should have everything you need. Look at this page to get started http://www.howtoforge.com/configure-remote-access-to-your-ubuntu-desktop
tested*
ok, how do i configure remote desktop settings through termian (SSH)
Don't know since I never used/heard of termian before.
terminal* excuse me
You want to run the Remote Desktop session through SSH for security?
no, i would like to set up my access prefrences through SSH cause my desktop is 25 miles to the west...
So you are not at the computer you want remote access to?
you are correct
im using ssh now to connect and use irssi
You currently have an SSH connection to the desktop, you now would like GUI access to the desktop. Is that correct?
that is correct
I have not test this command. Try this command: 'gconftool-2 -s -t bool /desktop/gnome/remote_access/enabled true'. Taken from http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=262376
it appears to have worked
how do i log in?
This file appears to have the info you need to setup an SSH tunnel for remote desktop.  http://www.mydemosite.org/Ubuntu-Remote-Desktop-Guide.pdf
i dont need the tunneling (yet) i just want to log in on a rdesktop session

Ok.  I've always run everything through an SSH tunnel so not sure what all you'll need to do.  But you'll need VNC on the local computer and probably need setup port forwarding one or both of the routers.
thats fine, i have VNC and everything is setup locally, ill go hame and work on it
